lead_paragraph: Since 2002, the Port Authority has distributed 1,890 pieces of the twin towers’ steel and 550 other objects that were housed in Hangar 17 at Kennedy Airport.

headline.print_headline: Once Filled With Symbols of Hope and Despair, a 9/11 Repository Will Close
headline.main: Once Filled With Symbols of Hope and Despair, a 9/11 Repository Is Set to Close

snippet: Since 2002, the Port Authority has distributed 1,890 pieces of the twin towers’ steel and 550 other objects that were housed in Hangar 17 at Kennedy Airport.
abstract: David W Dunlap Building Blocks column examines closing of Hangar 17 at Kennedy International Airport, used since 2002 as storage facility for salvage from clean up of World Trade Center site following September 11 terrorist attacks; Port Authority of New York and New Jersey has distributed thousands of salvaged objects to museums and schools, including National September 11 Memorial Museum.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
